```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE,
                      # saves output from code so it does not rerun everytime
                      cache = TRUE,
                      warning = FALSE, # supress warning
                      message = FALSE # supress messages
                      )
```


# Required packes

```{r packages}
if(require(pacman)==FALSE) install.packages("pacman")
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
```


# R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>. [example hyperlink](https://www.google.com/)

When you click the **Knit** button a *document* will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

---


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


## Some Analysis {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}

### Plot 1 {-}
```{r otherplots1, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```


### Plot 2 {-}
```{r otherplots2, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure) # sample plot again
```
